author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ontario’s auditor general says the province is not properly monitoring the billing practices of doctors, noting several cases in which physicians have billed for more than 24 hours in one day or for all 365 days of the year. Provincial auditor Shelley Spence presented the findings in an annual report, which found that the Ministry […]
title: Ontario Oversight Lapses Let Physicians Bill for More Than 24 Hours a Day: Auditor General

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Probe to review 11 areas, including victim retaliation, under-reporting, systemic failures and whether ADF justice matches civilian standards.
title: New Inquiry Into Sexual Violence in ADF to Proceed After a Year

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The defense secretary said he left part way through the operation and did not see survivors following the initial strike on Sept. 2.
title: Hegseth Says He Didn’t Watch 2nd Boat Strike, Backs Commander

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Floods and Landslides in Sumatra, Mass Wedding, and ‘The Desert Rose’ Diamond

author: Noé Chartier
description: A candidate for the federal Conservatives in the spring election says a supporter received a violent threat after meeting with him—one of several tactics he suspects Beijing may have used to undermine his campaign. Joe Tay, a former Hong Kong singer and actor turned democracy activist, was running for the Conservatives in the Don Valley […]
title: Tory Candidate Tells MPs of Extensive Foreign Interference by Beijing in His Campaign

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Quebec government has tabled a new bill to crack down on online ticket resales and to regulate subscription services. The new legislation would require ticket resellers to make clear that they are not the official seller and that consumers may find cheaper tickets from the original vendor. Quebec Justice Minister Simon Jolin-Barrette calls ticket […]
title: Quebec Justice Minister Tables Bill to Restrict Ticket Resellers

author: Jack Phillips
description: Attacks on the ground would mark an escalation of the conflict that has been brewing since September, when boats suspected of trafficking drugs were hit.
title: Trump Warns Strikes Inside Venezuela Will Start ‘Very Soon,’ Other Countries Could be Targeted

author: Jill McLaughlin
description: Joaquin Guzman Lopez is one of four sons of the drug kingpin who have faced charges related to drug trafficking in the United States.
title: Son of ‘El Chapo’ Pleads Guilty to Drug Charges in Chicago

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec Liberal Leader Pablo Rodriguez has expelled his former parliamentary leader from his caucus, saying she lacked loyalty to him and to the party. On Tuesday, Rodriguez said Marwah Rizqy has “done a lot of damage” to the party since she fired her chief of staff last month and kicked off an internal crisis. “She […]
title: Marwah Rizqy Booted From Quebec Liberal Caucus Amid Crisis in Party

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Tens of millions were spent by the RCMP on Chinese-made drones that pose a “high security” risk and will cost up to $34.1 million to replace, exceeding twice the initial investment, according to a government report. The internal report presented to the Senate national security committee indicates that 973 drones, making up 79 percent of […]
title: Mounties’ Fleet of Chinese-Built Drones Poses ‘High Security Risks’: Internal Report

author: Frank Fang
description: ‘China is working very hard to project narratives and disinformation in Washington and the United States,’ Taiwan Vice President Hsiao Bi-khim said.
title: China Targets Americans With Disinformation About Taiwan, Taiwanese VP Warns

author: Arjun Singh
description: The announcement came after Trump said that U.S. airspace over Venezuela should be considered closed until further notice.
title: Venezuela Permits US Deportation Flights to Continue Despite Trump’s Airspace Warning

author: Olivia Gomm
description: An alliance of law enforcement agencies across Canada seized 386 kilograms of fentanyl and analogues in less than half a year, with the bulk of the seizures taking place in Ontario and British Columbia, the RCMP says. The national initiative, dubbed the National Fentanyl Sprint 2.0, was coordinated by the Canadian Integrated Response to Organized […]
title: Canadian Law Enforcement Agencies Seize 386 Kilos of Fentanyl in 5-Month National Initiative

author: Bill Pan
description: Pokrovsk, a heavily fortified industrial town, has been the site of intense fighting for the past 18 months.
title: Russia Says It Seized Key Eastern Stronghold Pokrovsk; Ukraine Denies Claim

author: The Canadian Press
description: The CEO of Algoma Steel says he recognized the need to accelerate the company’s plan to lower its costs well before tariffs came into play, as the company plans to let go of more than 1,000 workers. Michael Garcia says in a statement that the strategy includes transitioning to electric arc furnace steelmaking, closing its […]
title: Algoma Steel Highlights New Strategy After Layoffs as It Looks to Lower Costs

author: Noé Chartier
description: Conservatives are reacting negatively to the Liberals reportedly agreeing to a Bloc Québécois demand to remove the religious defence around hate speech in the Criminal Code to secure support for its Bill C-9, the Combatting Hate Act. Media reports indicate the Liberals and the Bloc are poised to pass the related amendments as the House […]
title: Tories Say Removal of Religious Defence in Hate-Speech Law Is ‘Assault’ on Freedom of Speech, Religion

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Liberal government’s Build Canada Homes initiative, billed as a way to help double the pace of housing construction, will create just 26,000 housing units over five years, representing a 2.1 percent increase in housing completions, according to the Parliamentary Budget Officer (PBO). Build Canada Homes, a new federal agency intended to create housing through […]
title: Budget Watchdog Says Impact of Carney’s Home-Building Plan to Be ‘Modest’

author: Victoria Friedman
description: In the United States, the combined revenues of arms companies in the top 100 hit $338 billion, with 30 out of 39 arms companies seeing increased sales.
title: World’s Top Arms Producers See Record Revenue Last Year, Report Says

author: associated
description: BATANG TORU, Indonesia—Emergency crews raced to reach survivors and recover more bodies Tuesday as the death toll from last week’s catastrophic floods and landslides surged past 1,300 in Indonesia, Sri Lanka and Thailand, with nearly 900 people missing. Days of heavy monsoon rains inundated vast areas, leaving thousands stranded and many clinging to rooftops and […]
title: More Than 1,300 Dead From Floods in Indonesia, Sri Lanka and Thailand as Rescue Efforts Intensify

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada’s border agency is considering dropping its requirement for international travellers to report to customs before setting off on their travels abroad. The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) has launched a 30-day consultation on the proposed regulatory change known as the Free Flow International-to-International (ITI) Transit initiative that would remove the obligation for passengers to […]
title: Border Agency Mulls Ending Customs Check for Passengers With Canadian Stopovers

author: Rachel Roberts
description: President Luis Abinader confirmed details of the accord, which forms part of Washington's wider war on drug trafficking in the Caribbean and Pacific waters.
title: Dominican Republic Confirms US Access to Its Airports in Drug War to Last Until April

author: John Robson
description: Commentary When Alberta Premier Danielle Smith told her United Conservative Party convention that Canada could work, some people booed. Which is an interesting and instructive response, especially ideologically, because public policy seems to be divided between people who typically refuse to believe things can be as bad as they seem, and ones who refuse to […]
title: John Robson: Complacency in the Face of Bad Policy Can Be Dangerous, as Can Excessive Alarm

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Government job growth outpaced that of the private sector as the public service added nearly one million positions over the past decade, accounting for nearly one-third of the total employment increase in Canada, a new study suggests. Canada experienced a rise of 950,000 government sector jobs from 2015 to 2024, representing approximately 30 percent of […]
title: Government Jobs Drove 30% of Canada’s Employment Growth Over Past Decade: Study

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The software fix was ordered after a JetBlue Airways A320 flying from Mexico to New Jersey experienced a sudden uncommanded drop in altitude.
title: Airbus Finds Quality Issue With A320 Metal Panels

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The OECD said the United States is outperforming other advanced economies largely because of exceptionally strong investment in ICT and AI.
title: US Economy Outperforms on Back of Tech Investment Boom, OECD Says

author: The Canadian Press
description: An Alberta judge said a man who willingly joined an Islamic State group in the Middle East over a decade ago knew what he was doing and found him guilty Monday of three counts of participation in a terrorist group. Jamal Borhot, who is now 35, was convicted after being charged with travelling to Syria […]
title: Calgary Man Found Guilty of Three Terrorism-Related Charges Tied to ISIS

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The total number of those injured stands at 79, of whom 40 are still in hospital, Hong Kong Special Administration Region Chief Executive John Lee confirmed.
title: Hong Kong Launches Judge-Led Inquiry Into Deadly High-Rise Blaze That Killed 151

author: Melanie Sun
description: The White House said the meeting will be to sign the peace agreement reached earlier this year ending their 30 year war.
title: Trump to Host Leaders of Congo, Rwanda on Thursday

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The project is the latest to go ahead under the LNP government, which has backed coal and gas to power its future.
title: Queensland to Build First New Gas Power Plant in a Decade by 2028

author: Guy Birchall
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that the peace plan 'looks better' following his team's most recent discussions with the Americans.
title: Witkoff and Kushner to Meet Putin for Peace Talks: Kremlin

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Trump and Netanyahu discussed demilitarization of Hamas and expansion of peace agreements during a phone call on Dec. 1.
title: Trump to Host Netanyahu at White House, Prime Minister’s Office Says

author: PA Media
description: Labour MP Tulip Siddiq has been sentenced by a court in Bangladesh to two years in prison for corruption involving a government land project. Her aunt, ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina, was sentenced to five years. Ms Siddiq, who is MP for Hampstead and Highgate in London, has denied the allegations. The Labour Party has […]
title: Labour MP Tulip Siddiq Sentenced to 2 Years in Prison by Bangladeshi Court

author: PA Media
description: Afghan families who claim the SAS conducted a murder campaign against innocent civilians have expressed concerns that soldiers are “refusing to give evidence” as part of the inquiry. Their words follow evidence given by a senior officer to the Afghanistan Inquiry, who alleged the director of UK special forces (UKSF) made a “conscious decision” to […]
title: Afghan Families Express Concerns Over SAS Soldiers ‘Refusing to Give Evidence’

author: PA Media
description: Agency staff drafted in to keep services running during Birmingham’s bin strike have joined picket lines after staging their own walk-out amid disputed claims of bullying and harassment. The protests, including one attended by around 200 pickets at the Smithfield depot, near Birmingham city centre, prompted Birmingham City Council to suspend all bin collections on […]
title: Birmingham Bin Collection Services Suspended as Agency Staff Join Picket Lines

author: PA Media
description: The UK’s manufacturing sector returned to growth last month for the first time in more than a year, according to new figures. The S&P Global UK manufacturing PMI survey, watched closely by economists, showed a reading of 50.2 in November, improving from 49.7 in October. Any reading above 50 indicates that activity is growing while […]
title: UK Manufacturing Sector Grows for First Time in a Year

author: PA Media
description: Virgin Media has been fined £23.8 million by Ofcom after putting thousands of vulnerable customers at “direct risk of harm” when moving them to digital landlines. A number of serious incidents took place when Virgin was upgrading its customers’ home phone services in November and December 2023, the media and communications watchdog said. Virgin failed […]
title: Virgin Media Fined £23.8M After Putting Vulnerable Customers at ‘Risk of Harm’

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer has insisted that there was “no misleading” by Chancellor Rachel Reeves over the state of the public finances ahead of the Budget. Ms Reeves has faced claims she misled voters by overstating the scale of the fiscal challenge in the run-up to last week’s Budget, in which she announced £26 billion worth […]
title: Starmer Says There Was ‘No Misleading’ by Chancellor Ahead of Budget

author: The Associated Press
description: KINSHASA, Congo—Congo on Monday announced the end of an Ebola outbreak that killed 43 people in one of the country’s southern provinces, with authorities saying no new confirmed cases had been reported in the past 45 days. Health Minister Roger Kamba said the 43 deaths were among 53 confirmed cases in the outbreak, which was […]
title: Congo Declares Its Latest Ebola Outbreak Over, After 43 Deaths

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The average cost of the delegation was $38,000 per person.
title: Albanese Government Scrutinised for Spending $1.6 Million on Climate Delegation

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A South Australian mother claims her young daughter was subjected to teachings on bestiality and incest and shown graphic images of transgender surgery.
title: Mum Sues Government Over Bestiality, Incest Content in Diversity Class

author: Alfred Bui
description: Meanwhile, a 2025 report by Fire and Rescue NSW stated that EV fire risk accelerated with higher uptake.
title: Petrol Vehicles Are 5-20 Times More Likely to Catch Fire than EVs: Peak Body

description: The government will not be adopting the recommendations of the report.
title: ‘Patronage and Nepotism’: Review Critical of How Australian Officials Appointed

description: The government will not be adopting the recommendations of the report.

author: Andrew Moran
description: Shares of Korean car companies rose on the announcement, which followed South Korea's move to codify into law its investment commitments to the United States.
title: US Lowers Tariffs on South Korean Cars to 15 Percent

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Air quality testing is being carried out as investigations continue into Australian wind farms using Chinese-made components.
title: Asbestos Now Found in $1 Billion Queensland Wind Farm

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canada will be able to join Europe’s massive rearmament program following months of negotiations, but Ottawa has not indicated the cost of reaching such an agreement. Prime Minister Mark Carney has concluded negotiations for Canada’s participation in the Security Action for Europe (SAFE) program, as part of Canada’s Security and Defence Partnership with the European […]
title: Canada Reaches Agreement to Join EU Rearmament Program

author: Jill McLaughlin
description: OPEC decided to maintain current production levels into 2026 on fears of a global glut.
title: Oil Prices Inch Higher as US-Venezuela Tensions Grow

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The government announced in August that AI would become a priority, and the plan is an attempt to keep people safe while still leveraging the technology.
title: National AI Plan Aims to Balance Benefits and Risks, but Experts Warn the Workforce Lacks Training

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: E-bike limits may drop from 60km/h to 30km/h under proposed rules, with the premier indicating the change would be made through regulation, not legislation.
title: E-Bike Rider Killed in Sydney Collision With Garbage Truck

author: Frank Fang
description: The Chinese regime has been killing prisoners of conscience for their organs, turning China into a top destination for transplant tourism.
title: Experts Bring Focus to Forced Organ Harvesting at World Lawmaker Summit

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The Tesla boss made his comments in an interview with Indian billionaire Nikhil Kamath, also predicting the end of money and AI making work 'optional.'
title: Musk Says H-1B Visas Being ‘Gamed,’ but Defends System
